sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"使惊愕，使惊讶，使惊奇"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: surprise, amaze, astonish, astound, startle, stun
means: surprise ： 普通用词，多指因未预料或意外的事而引起的惊奇之感。
amaze ： 语气较强，指因认为不可能或极少可能发生情况的出现而感到惊讶或迷惑不解。
astonish ： 语气较强，指出乎预料，意外发生，但又无法解释而感到惊奇。
astound ： 语气强，指由于事情令人难以置信或实在罕见而使人感到震惊。
startle ： 指因突然的惊吓或意料不到的刺激等而使人惊跳或震惊。
stun ： 语气最强，指极度惊讶而目瞪口呆，不知所措。

sentence.Network_en: Sue screamed, not loudly, more in surprise than terror.
sentence.Network_cn: 休尖叫起来，声音不大，吃惊多于恐惧。

sentence.Network_en: The Foreign Office in London has expressed surprise at these allegations.
sentence.Network_cn: 位于伦敦的英国外交部对这些说法表示惊讶.

sentence.Network_en: She looked as if the photographer had caught her by surprise.
sentence.Network_cn: 看上去，她好像被摄影师搞了个猝不及防。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（在给予别人惊奇时说的）真惊奇，真惊奇

jx.jx_en_mean: attack or capture someone or something unexpectedly
jx.jx_cn_mean: 出其不意地攻击（或俘获）

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'unexpected seizure of a place, or attack on troops'): from Old French, feminine past participle of surprendre, from medieval Latin superprehendere 'seize'

entry.tran: 意想不到的事;突如其来的事;令人惊奇的事(或消息等)
entry.def: A surprise is an unexpected event, fact, or piece of news.

example.ex: I have a surprise for you: We are moving to Switzerland!...
example.tran: 我有一个惊喜的消息要告诉你：我们要搬去瑞士了！

example.ex: It may come as a surprise to some that a normal, healthy child is born with many skills...
example.tran: 一个身体健康正常的小孩天生就会许多技能，这或许会令有些人感到惊奇。

entry.def: Surprise is the feeling that you have when something unexpected happens.

example.ex: The Foreign Office in London has expressed surprise at these allegations...
example.tran: 位于伦敦的英国外交部对这些说法表示惊讶。

example.ex: 'You mean he's going to vote against her?' Scobie asked in surprise...
example.tran: 斯科比惊讶地问道：“你是说他会投她的反对票吗？”

entry.tran: 使惊奇;使诧异;使感到意外
entry.def: If something surprises you, it gives you a feeling of surprise.

example.ex: We'll solve the case ourselves and surprise everyone...
example.tran: 我们要自己解决这件事，然后让所有人感到吃惊。

example.ex: It surprised me that a driver of Alain's experience should make those mistakes...
example.tran: 令我惊讶的是像阿兰这样经验丰富的司机竟然会犯那样的错误。

entry.def: If you surprise someone, you give them, tell them, or do something pleasant that they are not expecting.

example.ex: Surprise a new neighbour with one of your favourite home-made dishes.
example.tran: 做一道拿手的家常小菜，给你的新邻居一个惊喜。

entry.tran: 使人惊异(或意想不到)的事物;让人大吃一惊的人
entry.def: If you describe someone or something as a surprise, you mean that they are very good or pleasant although you were not expecting this.

example.ex: ...Senga MacFie, one of the surprises of the World Championships three months ago...
example.tran: 森加·麦克菲，三个月前世界锦标赛上的一匹黑马

example.ex: My father decided to slip a little extra spending money into my purse as a surprise.
example.tran: 为了给我一个惊喜，父亲决定往我的钱包里多塞一些零花钱。

entry.tran: 突袭;使措手不及;使毫无防备
entry.def: If you surprise someone, you attack, capture, or find them when they are not expecting it.

example.ex: Marlborough led his armies across the Rhine and surprised the French and Bavarian armies near the village of Blenheim.
example.tran: 马尔伯勒带领他的部队穿过莱茵河，在离布莱尼姆村不远的地方向法国和巴伐利亚联军发动了突袭。

entry.tran: 一点儿都不稀奇;可想而知
entry.def: You can say 'surprise, surprise' if you disapprove of something because it is not surprising or original, or could easily have been predicted.

example.ex: There is a shortage of carrots. So everybody starts growing carrots. Next season, surprise, surprise, there is a glut of carrots.
example.tran: 胡萝卜紧缺，于是大家都去种胡萝卜。等到来年这个时候，可想而知，胡萝卜就会过剩。

entry.tran: (用于遇见熟人或给别人一些意想不到的东西时)想不到吧
entry.def: You can say 'surprise, surprise' if you meet someone you know or give them something when they are not expecting it.

example.ex: He came back in as I was heading up to the shower. 'Surprise, surprise,' he said.
example.tran: 我正要去淋浴时他回来了。“想不到吧，”他说。

entry.def: If something takes you by surprise, it happens when you are not expecting it or when you are not prepared for it.

example.ex: His question took his two companions by surprise...
example.tran: 他提的问题让他的两个伙伴都愣住了。

example.ex: Whenever it snows in Britain we are taken by surprise.
example.tran: 每次英国下雪，我们都会感到惊讶。

means.word_mean: 1. the astonishment you feel when something totally unexpected happens to you

auth_sentence.res_content: The real surprise is the approach taken by Gergiev.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有进取心的,有事业心的
stems_affixes.word_buile: enterprise事业心,进取心+ing……的→adj.有进取心的,有事业心的
surprise诧异,惊异+ing状态→adj.令人惊讶的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 事业,企[事]业单位;事业心,进取心
stems_affixes.word_buile: enter进入+prise拿住,抓住→进入抓住[目标]→把某一事业掌握一定范围→企业;事业
sur在……上面+prise拿住,抓住→在上面突然被抓住→吃惊
ap加强动作+prise拿住,抓住→抓住信息

stems_affixes.value_cn: 包含,包括,由……组成;构成,组成
stems_affixes.word_buile: com全部+prise拿住,抓住→全部抓住→包括
sur在……上面+prise拿住,抓住→在上面突然被抓住→吃惊

Sentence.sentence: I'm surprised that was still in business.
You would not be surprised if a stranger tried to shake hands when you were introduced, but you might be a little startled if they bowed, started to stroke you or kissed you on both cheeks.
It is reported that 49 million Americans are unsure of where they will find their next meal What's most surprising is that 36% of them live in households where at least one adult is working.

If you say no, however, it may surprise you to learn that you are only unemployed if you've been actively looking for work in the past four weeks; otherwise, you are "marginally attached to the labor force" and not actually unemployed.
The recent economic crisis has taken the US by surprise

sentences.en: He may surprise us all yet.
sentences.cn: 他总有一天会让我们大家惊奇。

sentences.en: I surprised everyone by wearing a terrible mask.
sentences.cn: 我带了一副可怕的面具, 使大家受惊了。

sentences.en: They surprised us with a visit.
sentences.cn: 他们突然来访使我们大感意外。

sentences.en: It surprised me to see so many people there.
sentences.cn: 在那里看到那么多人使我感到意外。

sentences.en: It surprised them that she was such a fine swimmer.
sentences.cn: 她游得这么好, 使他们都很惊奇。

means.word_mean: 意外发现[撞见], 出其不意获得

sentences.en: We surprised the burglars opening the safe.
sentences.cn: 窃贼在开保险箱时被我们撞上了。

sentences.en: The police surprised the thief into confessing.
sentences.cn: 警察出其不意地使小偷招认了。

sentences.en: I'll never forget his surprise when we told him.
sentences.cn: 我永远不会忘记我们告诉他时他所表现出来的惊讶表情。

sentences.en: Sue was overcome by surprise when Peter walked in.
sentences.cn: 当彼得走进屋时, 苏吓了一跳。
他惊奇地抬头看了一下。

means.word_mean: 令人吃惊的事物; 意想不到（或突然）的事; 令人惊奇的事（或消息等）

sentences.cn: 我们得到了一些令人不快的意外消息。

sentences.en: The whole thing is a surprise to us.
sentences.cn: 整个事情出乎我们的意料。

jushi.english: The next contestant surprised me. She made 139 jumps in half a minute.
jushi.chinese: 下一个参加跳绳比赛的人使我吃惊,她在半分钟之内跳了139下。

jushi.english: Her calmness at reception of the bad news surprised us.
jushi.chinese: 她接受那个坏消息时的平静态度令我们吃惊。

jushi.english: They surprised the animals at their food.
jushi.chinese: 他们乘那些动物吃食时突然袭击了它们。
